docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Main Courses
docs.text:
Here are some main course recipes to choose from:

  • Spaghetti Carbonara
  • Homemade Pizza
  • Add more main course recipes here...

docs.title: For the dough:
docs.text:
• 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast
  • 1 teaspoon white sugar
  • 1 1/2 cups warm water (110°F/45°C)
  • 3 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 1/2 teaspoons salt

docs.title: For the toppings:
docs.text:
• 1/2 cup pizza sauce
  • 2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese
  • Your choice of toppings (e.g., pepperoni, bell peppers, mushrooms, onions)

docs.title: Making the dough:
docs.text:
1. Activate the yeast:

  2. In a small bowl, dissolve the yeast and sugar in warm water. Let it stand until foamy, about 5 minutes.

  3. Mix the dough:

  4. In a large bowl, combine the flour, olive oil, salt, and yeast mixture. Mix until a dough forms.

  5. Knead the dough:

  6. Turn the

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 200g spaghetti
  • 100g pancetta
  • 2 large eggs
  • 50g pecorino cheese
  • 50g parmesan
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • Salt and black pepper

docs.title: Instructions
docs.text:
1. Prepare the ingredients:
  2. Grate the pecorino cheese and parmesan.

  3. Beat the eggs in a medium bowl, season with a little freshly grated black pepper, and set aside.

  4. Cook the pasta:

  5. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.

  6. Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions.

  7. Cook the pancetta:

  8. Heat a large skillet over medium heat.
  9. Add the pancetta and cook until it becomes crispy.

Cooking tip

Reserve some pasta water before draining. You might need it to adjust the sauce's consistency.

  1. Combine and serve:
  2. Add the drained spaghetti to the skillet with pancetta.
  3. Remove from heat and quickly add the egg and cheese mixture, stirring constantly.
  4. Adjust with reserved pasta water if needed.
  5. Serve immediately, topped with extra cheese and black pepper.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• For a vegetarian version, you can substitute the pancetta with sautéed mushrooms.
  • Make sure to remove the skillet from the heat before adding the egg mixture to avoid scrambling the eggs.
